history.content:
From the schedule, I see that the lecture start times for Cog Sci 1 and DS100/CS186 conflict.

Since the lecture start times conflict, it means that their finals would coincide and therefore, one of the classes would necessarily have to provide an alternate final. This is often unlikely and depends on the professor/number of students deciding to take these two classes concurrently (which I believe would be less). Even then, the best thing to do would be to check with the professors of the respective classes.

As for the answers to your questions,

1. Attendance not required in both, but DS100 gives you points for attendance.

2. Both webcasted.

On Data Science 100, going off on how it's been this semester: Yes, lectures are webcasted, but attendance is taken by way of "i-clicker" questions (they're really google surveys). You need to attend 18 of the lectures or so to get full credit. Otherwise, anything below that, points will be deducted from your attendance grade. You should check the course website for more information on the grading policy: ds100.org.

Hi - currently enrolled in Cog Sci 1 next semester and it's unfortunately (don't know who thought about this) scheduled at the same time as both DS100 and CS186. Thinking that I'm going to choose one of these classes. Have two questions for each of the classes.

1. Is attendance required in both?

2. Is either webcasted? 

Based on this it looks like I'll have to fill out a schedule conflict form to make this work.

Thanks!
history.subject: Are either DS100 or CS186 going to be webcasted? / If so can I fill out a schedule conflict form?
